page.title: 03ECOLOGY
page.content: This is a pleasant, rolling country- side of hill and valley,falling away each side of a ridge plateau.Tree cover is mainly deciduous trees and scrub intermingled with a few stands of conifers.There are Ashover grit- stone outcrops in places like Cocking Tor,and exposed faces where rock was quarried.The derelict mine sites show a wealth of flowers and grasses.We saw harebells,poppies,reedmace, and meadowsweet that filled the air with a scent like new-mown hay.Birds were busy in the quiet lanes and woods,thrushes,jays and collared doves,but three kestrels hovered on the uplands watching the field mice foraging amongst the grasses,and there was a rank smell of fox behind the bushes,showing the other side of the quietness and peace.
